instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PM_SLP_S5_L: What is PM_SLP_S5_L? PM_SLP_S5_L is a signal that, when 3.3v, turns on power rails that will wake the system from an S5 state. This signal is a part of the power management system of the MacBook.  The \"PM\" prefix typically stands for \"Power Management,\" and the \"SLP\" is for \"Sleep.\" The \"S5\" denotes the specific sleep state, which is Suspend to Disk, and the \"_L\" suffix indicates that this is an active low signal..
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good‚Äù and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.P5VS4RS3_EN_R: What is P5VS4RS3_EN_R? P5VS4RS3_EN_R is an enable signal that turns on the PP5V_S4RS3 power rail. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. The _R means the signal is asserted when the voltage is high(3.3v). .
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..
definitions.SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD: What is SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD? SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a pre-requisite for SYS_PWROK_R and PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
liquid damaged board. someone attempted repair this board, backlight driver is missing and has been ultrasoniced :(

green then orange light on magsafe 2 (genuine adapter), no fan spin, CPU does get little warm after a while.

- <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> = 16.66v
- <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 8,58V
- <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3,41V
- <SIGNAL>PPV5_S5</SIGNAL> = 5V
- <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> = 0.724V
- PP3v3 = 3,3V
- <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> = 0V
- <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> = 0V
- <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.294v
- <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> = 0.001V
- <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> = 0.001V
- <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5_L</SIGNAL> = 0.001V
- <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> = 3.4v
- <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.4v
- <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL> = 3.429v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: i cant tell if these chips has been replaced or just rework.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: You can clearly see the solder blobs on some traces. Could be anything at this point, rabbit hole board that has been messed with, worst case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: the solder blobs on some traces are not shorted. should i leave this board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: No they are not shorted. It does mean someone fucked with it and gave up. At this point there is no telling what happened to the board. Only continue with this if you have nothing better to do.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> is missing.
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> is missing

<CHIP>U8080</CHIP> create <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>


what create <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> ?


<CHIP>U7501</CHIP> create <SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN_R</SIGNAL>

<SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN_R</SIGNAL> is 0v

pin14, pin29 of <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> is 5v


bad <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: Why would <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> generate its own enable. <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> is missing which is worst case. Check RTC voltages

<CHIP>U1900</CHIP>

pin1 = 3.294v

pin12 = 0.391v
pin13= 3.432v


Y1905

pin1 = 1.005v
pin3 = 1.265v


i dont have a oliscope.



0v on <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
